revised_title: Observations on Respiration and the Composition of Fixed Air
tldr: The author, Joseph Priestley, conducted experiments to understand the process of respiration and the composition of fixed air. He discovered that during respiration, dephlogisticated air (oxygen) enters the blood and combines with phlogiston (a substance released from the blood) to form fixed air (carbon dioxide). This finding challenged the existing understanding of respiration and the role of dephlogisticated air in the process.
